t: Luke 24
Now*p upon the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain others with them.
And*p they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.
And*p they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
And*p it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:
And*p as they were afraid, and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?
He*p is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,
Saying,*p The*r Son*r of*r man*r must*r be*r delivered*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinful*r men,*r and*r be*r crucified,*r and*r the*r third*r day*r rise*r again.*r
And*p they remembered his words,
And*p returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.
It*p was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary the mother of James, and other women that were with them, which told these things unto the apostles.
And*p their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.
Then*p arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.
And,*p behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs.
And*p they talked together of all these things which had happened.
And*p it came to pass, that, while they communed together and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
But*p their eyes were holden that they should not know him.
And*p he said unto them, What*r manner*r of*r communications*r are*r these*r that*r ye*r have*r one*r to*r another,*r as*r ye*r walk,*r and*r are*r sad?*r
And*p the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?
And*p he said unto them, What*r things?*r And they said unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:
And*p how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.
But*p we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.
Yea,*p and certain women also of our company made us astonished, which were early at the sepulchre;
And*p when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.
And*p certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.
Then*p he said unto them, O*r fools,*r and*r slow*r of*r heart*r to*r believe*r all*r that*r the*r prophets*r have*r spoken:*r
Ought*rp not*r Christ*r to*r have*r suffered*r these*r things,*r and*r to*r enter*r into*r his*r glory?*r
And*p beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.
And*p they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.
But*p they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent. And he went in to tarry with them.
And*p it came to pass, as he sat at the table with them, he took bread, and blessed it, and brake, and gave to them.
And*p their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.
And*p they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures?
And*p they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,
Saying,*p The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.
And*p they told what things were done in the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.
And*p as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace*r be*r unto*r you.*r
But*p they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
And*p he said unto them, Why*r are*r ye*r troubled?*r and*r why*r do*r thoughts*r arise*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Behold*rp my*r hands*r and*r my*r feet,*r that*r it*r is*r I*r myself:*r handle*r me,*r and*r see;*r for*r a*r spirit*r hath*r not*r flesh*r and*r bones,*r as*r ye*r see*r me*r have.*r
And*p when he had thus spoken, he shewed them his hands and his feet.
And*p while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have*r ye*r here*r any*r meat?*r
And*p they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.
And*p he took it, and did eat before them.

And*p he said unto them, These*r are*r the*r words*r which*r I*r spake*r unto*r you,*r while*r I*r was*r yet*r with*r you,*r that*r all*r things*r must*r be*r fulfilled,*r which*r were*r written*r in*r the*r law*r of*r Moses,*r and*r in*r the*r prophets,*r and*r in*r the*r psalms,*r concerning*r me.*r
Then*p opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,
And*p said unto them, Thus*r it*r is*r written,*r and*r thus*r it*r behoved*r Christ*r to*r suffer,*r and*r to*r rise*r from*r the*r dead*r the*r third*r day:*r
And*rp that*r repentance*r and*r remission*r of*r sins*r should*r be*r preached*r in*r his*r name*r among*r all*r nations,*r beginning*r at*r Jerusalem.*r
And*rp ye*r are*r witnesses*r of*r these*r things.*r
And,*rp behold,*r I*r send*r the*r promise*r of*r my*r Father*r upon*r you:*r but*r tarry*r ye*r in*r the*r city*r of*r Jerusalem,*r until*r ye*r be*r endued*r with*r power*r from*r on*r high.*r
And*p he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
And*p it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.
And*p they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:
And*p were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
